intro: Licania belloi, commonly known as the Brazilian licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
